content:
with time user will forget which topics the user has muted, and if due to some reason the user needs to see some muted topics, it's a long process of going to settings and viewing muted topics there, which I think user will forget.
currently there's only one place i.e user settings where one can view all of their muted topics,
but I don't think a new user of Zulip will know this. Even I didn't knew where to see all my muted topics till I opened settings for changing my profile pic.

We can increase the accessibility of muted topics by adding a button below or above + Add streams saying Muted topics which may either open the muted topics tab in settings or list all muted topics in the central area (message area) whichever is feasible.
What say?
@RISHABH D TIWARI u can see your muted topics in recent topics by checking include muted.

I do agree that it would be nicer to have a more discoverable way to manage your muted topics. OTOH I am a bit reluctant to take up too much main-screen real estate for muted topics. In my experience I have almost never regretted forgetting about a muted topic, because if somebody really needs my attention, they can still get it.
If we had to add it anywhere on the main screen, though, I think putting a handy link at the bottom of your stream list, as @RISHABH D TIWARI suggests, would be as good a place as any.

I agree with your point @Aman Agrawal , but in recent topics there are unmuted topics too, which gives a clustered look.
A nice place to manage muted topics will be better.

Steve Howell said:

I do agree that it would be nicer to have a more discoverable way to manage your muted topics. OTOH I am a bit reluctant to take up too much main-screen real estate for muted topics. In my experience I have almost never regretted forgetting about a muted topic, because if somebody really needs my attention, they can still get it.

I agree @Steve Howell that generally we wouldn't regret forgetting about muted topic, but this will be when we mute topic intentionally.
But if one mutes the topic by mistake, it would be better to give the user a place to manage it easily.
This idea itself clicked me when to test muting of topics, I muted some topics in #announce and some other streams but then couldn't find where to unmute them
should I create an issue and start working on this? Please confirm.
